headline: Wages Rise At Low End, Gilding Data
abstract: Increases in minimum wages across the country may make the labor market look a bit rosier than it really is.
lead_paragraph: These days, wages in the United States are doing something extraordinary: Theyâ€™re growing faster at the bottom than at the top. In fact, recent growth for workers with low wages has outpaced that for high-wage workers by the widest margin in at least 20 years.
